I previously posted a problem I was having using the JUnit framework 
with Visual J++. Mr problems specifically were that when I tried to 
run the test code supplied with JUnit, I got IO exceptions to do with 
CreateProcess. 

I posted details of my problems to the MS Java-COM mailing list. Don 
McCaughey used to have the same problems and had managed to find the 
cause and the solution. I am cross posting his message here (he has 
given me the ok to do this) so that any other Visual J++ users who 
run into the same issues will be able to find the answer here, too.

Don's message:

If you check the source code for the test fixture that's failing
(junit.tests.TextRunnerTest), notice that it attempts to build the 
path to java.exe (Sun's equivalent of jview.exe) in order to run a 
class in another process using Runtime.exec().  Microsoft's Java is 
organized differently so this fails.  It also fails under 
junit.awtui.TestRunner and junit.swingui.TestRunner won't work at all 
since VJ++ doesn't have the Swing libraries.  All the other tests ran 
so you're in good shape.

-Don

Sure enough, I modified the test code to use the "JView" command 
instead of "java" and everything works perfectly.

Hope this helps.

Regards,

Krishna
